selected_quotes: Hand Grip Strength in Smokers Predicts Future Acute Respiratory Events #CHEST2016
Important, but not surprising that clinical measurements of frailty associated with outcomes in copd!

citation.title: Hand Grip Strength in Smokers Predicts Future Acute Respiratory Events, and Is Associated With Body Composition, Independently of Body Mass Index and Measures of Airflow

author.name: Maor Sauler
author.description: Pulmonologist, Intensivist, Researcher, Educator - Yale School of Medicine.

news.title: Keeping it simple: Can resting heart rate and hand grip strength predict future pulmonary health problems?
news.summary: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 17, 2016 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Two studies will be presented during the CHEST Annual Meeting 2016 in Los Angeles that illustrate how something as simple as a patient's resting heart rate or handgrip strength can predict future…
